content.description: This is cool looking line climbing the obvious prow like feature. It’s easier than it looks due to the abundance of good holds, although the topout is a little tricky. It’s possible to pre-inspect the entire upper part of the line while standing on the slab to the left; it’s also possible to step off onto it if necessary.
content.protection: 2 crashpads, a spotter could increase the safety factor.
content.location: SDS below the left side of the overhang using a doorknob like hold for the LH and a good crimp for the RH. Climb up and then slightly left on great holds to surmount the overhang, then straight up the smooth face.

content.description: This is a small grotto-like spot located at the very top of a steep ravine on the west side of the canyon. It features some unusual china-like white rock that’s very clean. Due to its location it’s typically cool and shaded from mid afternoon on.
